title: How to Make Ojibwe Style Frybread

steps.title: Pour flour into one of the medium sized bowls.
steps.content: Pour flour into one of the medium sized bowls. Push flour to the sides of the bowl making a hole in the middle, the hole in the flour will imitate another bowl.

steps.title: Mix milk with water and microwave for two minutes.
steps.content: Mix milk with water and microwave for two minutes. Pour into the flour bowl.

steps.title: Add yeast or baking powder and let stand for 3 or 4 minutes, so the yeast can mix with the liquid.
steps.content: Add yeast or baking powder and let stand for 3 or 4 minutes, so the yeast can mix with the liquid.

steps.title: Start mixing slowly pulling in small amounts of the flour.
steps.content: Start mixing slowly pulling in small amounts of the flour.

steps.title: Make sure not to let any lumps of flour be present in the mixture
steps.content: Make sure not to let any lumps of flour be present in the mixture Mix until too thick to mix with spoon or whisk.

steps.title: Use hands to mix in remaining flour into developing bread.
steps.content: Use hands to mix in remaining flour into developing bread.

steps.title: Oil the sides of the 2nd medium sized bowl and transfer dough.
steps.content: Oil the sides of the 2nd medium sized bowl and transfer dough.

steps.title: Knead for 1 to 2 minutes (do not over knead).
steps.content: Knead for 1 to 2 minutes (do not over knead).

steps.title: Let dough rise for 1 to 2 hours or until it rises to a considerable amount close to double its size (covering the bowl of dough with a towel helps the process).
steps.content: Let dough rise for 1 to 2 hours or until it rises to a considerable amount close to double its size (covering the bowl of dough with a towel helps the process).

steps.title: Fill medium sized skillet halfway with cooking oil and heat on medium-high heat
steps.content: Fill medium sized skillet halfway with cooking oil and heat on medium-high heat Throw in a small piece of dough to make sure the cooking oil is ready to fry in.

steps.title: Be careful to not start a fire!
steps.content: Be careful to not start a fire!

steps.title: Grease your hands because dough will be sticky.
steps.content: Grease your hands because dough will be sticky.

steps.title: Tear a chunk off your dough then start pancaking (like making a hamburger patty) and stretching into a circular shape.
steps.content: Tear a chunk off your dough then start pancaking (like making a hamburger patty) and stretching into a circular shape.

steps.title: Then tear a small hole in the middle to be sure the middle cooks.
steps.content: Then tear a small hole in the middle to be sure the middle cooks.

steps.title: Fry bread pieces may be whatever size you would like.
steps.content: Fry bread pieces may be whatever size you would like.

steps.title: Place dough in the oil and cook until golden brown.
steps.content: Place dough in the oil and cook until golden brown. Flip and repeat on the other side until done.

steps.title: Enjoy your bread, top with butter, sugar, honey or good old fashioned taco meat with cheese, lettuce, tomatoes (onions & sour cream optional) to make a famous Indian Taco
steps.content: Enjoy your bread, top with butter, sugar, honey or good old fashioned taco meat with cheese, lettuce, tomatoes (onions & sour cream optional) to make a famous Indian Taco
